comments:
After a few manipulation on an ANT script in a project my workspace has reach a 
state where I can't put any ant script in the root directory of the project.  
Wathever the ant script that I put on this directory, each time that I want to 
launch it with the "Run Ant..." action, the window show me an error 
saying "BUILD FAILED".  I have tried to restart eclipse and replace the script 
by a script that I'm sure is correct, but nothing change.  I have tried to move 
the script in an other directory, and it works.

Here is an extract from the .metadata/.log

Gilles,

Somehow a property has a value of "null" and this is attempting to be placed 
in a hashtable.

What properties have you specified for the build (global properties in the Ant 
preferences)?

I didn't add anything to the global properties.

However, I played with the "local" confighuration of the ANT script (accessed 
via the "Run ANT..." menu.

And I think that's the orign of the problem : I put an additional classpath 
entry.

But the entry that I have added doesn't exist anymore (and don't need it 
anymore)

The problem is that I can't remove this "incorrect" entry in the classpath.  
Actually, I can remove it, but I can't push on the "aply" button to store the 
removing.  And even when I remove it, the BUILD FAILED message is still there.

My previous asumption on the origin of the problem was wrong.  I have 
regenerate the jar file that was in the class path addition entries, but I 
still have the same problem.

The other things I have played with the local configuration was :
Adding an argument -Debug
Playing with the launch configuration, but I reset it to Local

Note that the problem occurs only with one particular directory (If I move the 
script elsewhere it works), and wathever the content of the script (I even 
tried to put an empty one with just the project tags.

The line number that the stack trace is indicating is when the Eclipse Ant 
framework is iterating over the user properties.

Can you:

provide the .launch file for the build that fails. This can be found in the 
workspace directory\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.debug.core\.launches\*.launch

provide an example of path to the directory where the failure occurs

Created an attachment (id=5612)
Launch file that trigger the bug

Created an attachment (id=5613)
Launch file that trigger the bug (2)

There is actually 2 files that (seems) corresponding to my ANT script.
They have the name : "TestTemplater build.xml.launch" and 
"TestTemplater build.xml (1).launch"

Both files are put in attachment.

The directory where I can not put any ANT script is : 
"D:\Program Files\eclipse\workspace\TestTemplater".

Both Eclipse's integration and Apache Ant seem to have a bug dealing 
with "-Debug". Change to use "-debug". When it is "-Debug" we attempt to 
process it as a property (specified with -Dname=value).

Logged http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22065 in Ant land.

Fixed in InternalAntRunner.
As I have never seen the JDK parse out the args into -Dname, value so I removed 
the comment and code to handle this case.
Refactored as well.

Added two tests to the Option tests.
